column4: not sure if i'm able to phrase this question clearly, but... is there a way to stream music from my pc to another pc on another network (through ssh)?  if so, what method would you recommend?
http://www.videolan.org/doc/streaming-howto/en/
you may want to look at a web frontend like jinzora
mpd+icecast works well, but is complex to setup
Flannel :  ok, i think i've read somewhere that icecast and shoutcast works with MOC too...
there are tons of console clients for mpd
ah, ok... i haven't read anything about mpd... thought maybe it was a client as well, but i guess it's a server?
Flannel : thank you for now, i'll read more about the subject(s) on my own
it is normal depending on size of disk and filesystem
no, i know the two number system :)
formatting with a journaled filesystem also takes space
what do you have what do you want, what is issue
ok, i used gparted and formatted to ext3
well, basically i would like to free up the used space
how big hard drive, what amount of space is missing... give us details or we cant help
ok, sorry... the disc's total capacity is 229.2GB,  used space = 11.8GB
ext3 uses approx 5% of space
http://boncey.org/2006_11_18_reclaiming_ext3_disk_space
ok, but i remember seeing someone having the exact same problem in here once... and someone gave him a quick fix... can't remember what
it is there for a reason...
thank you very much, that did it
